p: The Virtual Sugarcane Biorefinery (VSB), developed at the Brazilian Bioethanol Science and Technology Laboratory (CTBE), was employed to perform the techno-economic and environmental assessment of sugarcane biorefineries. The VSB is a computational framework that allows simulation and evaluation of the entire sugarcane chain and other biomasses (from biomass production to final products use) considering the three pillars of sustainability: economic, environmental, and social [ 24]. In this work, comparison between 1G plants and integrated 1G and 2G (1G2G) ethanol production units was carried out, considering three time horizons: short (2016–2020), medium (2021–2025), and long (2026–2030) terms.
